title: Applied Financial Accounting
description: The objective of this course is to develop an understanding of accounting procedures and learn how to judge corporate financial statements. Through case studies, students will learn to interpret the numbers and make inferences about the financial health of a company. The course includes a comparison of best practices and an introduction to International Financial Reporting Standards. Renumbered from IRGN 474. Students may not receive credit for GPIM 474 and IRGN 474.
